instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.C1950: What is C1950? Capacitor between PP3V42_G3H & ground on pin 8 of U1950 on 2013-2015 Macbook Pros & Airs that often corrodes. When corroded, pin 8 on U1950 will be damaged, which will prevent machine from booting and cause PM_SLP_S4_L to pulse. .
definitions.PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT: What is PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT? Power rail for RAM. .
definitions.PPHV_S0SW_LCDBKLT: What is PPHV_S0SW_LCDBKLT? PPHV_S0SW_LCDBKLT is a power rail that powers the backlight on the LCD screen, this is necessary to get the screen to light up..
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL: What is PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL? This is the voltage coming directly from the charger after going through a transistor. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .
definitions.PP3V3_S4: What is PP3V3_S4? The "PP3V3_S4" power rail in a MacBook is used to supply 3.3 volts to certain components when the system is in the S4 power state, also known as "suspend to disk" or "hibernate." This rail is active when the MacBook is not fully off but not in an awake state, allowing for faster startup times compared to a full boot sequence. The S4 power state means Suspend to Disk: This is a low-power state where the system context is saved to disk, allowing the system to be powered down almost entirely. Upon waking, the system can restore its state from the disk, effectively resuming where it left off..
definitions.PP5V_S4RS3: What is PP5V_S4RS3? PP5V_S4RS3 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.PP1V05_S0:
What is PP1V05_S0? The PP1V05_S0 power rail is for various components on the logic board that require a 1.05V supply voltage in the S0 (on) state. This voltage rail is likely to be used by the CPU (for VCCIO), PCH (Platform Controller Hub).

.
definitions.PP1V5_S0: What is PP1V5_S0? PP1V5_S0 is a 1.5v power rail present when the machine is in an S0 working state.
definitions.PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS: What is PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS? This power rail is PPBUS_G3H after going through a current sense resistor that sits between PPBUS_G3H & the input of PPBUS_G3H to circuitry that provides power for the CPU..
definitions.PP1V2_S3: What is PP1V2_S3? PP1V2_S3 is a 1.2v power rail present when the machine is in an S3 suspend to RAM state.
definitions.PP1V8_S3: What is PP1V8_S3? The PP1V8_S3 signal in the MacBook schematic is a power rail that provides a voltage of 1.8 volts during the S3 power state. The S3 state, often referred to as "suspend to RAM," is a low-power mode where the computer saves the session's state to RAM, allowing for quicker wake-up times compared to a full shutdown..
definitions.PP1V05_SUS: What is PP1V05_SUS? The PP1V05_SUS signal in the MacBook schematic is a power rail that supplies 1.05 volts, typically used in a suspended (SUS) state of the laptop. This state is a low-power mode where essential system functions are maintained, but the majority of the system is powered down..
definitions.PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS: What is PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS? This is PPBUS_G3H after passing through a current sense resistor that splits it off from the rest of PPBUS_G3H. The purpose of this is so that we can measure how much current is flowing to this part of the machine..

threads.title: macbook air no power <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
this board was water damaged i put it in ultrasonic cleanner and then tested 
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> -> 8.164V
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> -> 15.126V
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> -> 3.42V
any ideas?

threads.title: macbook air no power <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
found a problem the:
L5001 was 0V pin one pad was gone
<RESISTOR>R5193</RESISTOR> was 0V on pad 2 and the pad was gone

from <RESISTOR>R5117</RESISTOR>(pad2) -> 3.42V

I put a wire from <RESISTOR>R5117</RESISTOR>(pad2) to L5001(pad1) and <RESISTOR>R5193</RESISTOR>(pad2)
Now I have a green light the fan is spinning and there's no chime

I'm back to square one. any advice?

threads.title: macbook air no power <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: Where was water damage before ultrasonic cleaner?? Inspect under microscope, look for more missing pads or resistors....

threads.title: macbook air no power <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
no idea I bought the board clean
I can't find anything

threads.title: macbook air no power <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: Connect a USB mouse and see if it lights up.

threads.title: macbook air no power <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: it doesn't light up

threads.title: macbook air no power <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: Corrosion somewhere, look closer, may also be corrosion under the SMC. No way for me to tell over the internet.

threads.title: macbook air no power <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
I've receive my new microscope witch is fantastic apart from the camera I paid for 5mp camera it it looks awful. I found on <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> pad 8 missing also the <CAPACITOR>C1950</CAPACITOR> didn't had a pad. I puled a wire from <CAPACITOR>C1950</CAPACITOR> to pad 8.
after a closer look I found <TRANSISTOR>Q1840</TRANSISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q1842</TRANSISTOR> problems and i replace those. After I fix it I plug it and the fan is spinning and I hear a dong this was without the screen. I connected the screen and when I tried to boot a second time it didn't work anymore. the fan is spinning for 3 seconds and it stops and it repeating and no dong this time. any thoughts?

threads.title: macbook air no power <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: Did you pull and replace <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>? If yes then there is still some corrosion somewhere, no magic bullet here.

threads.title: macbook air no power <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: I replaced the <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> and I looked like a 100 time and still can't fine any problems. So all the rails g3h are present all the time and S0 S3 S5 they work for a few seconds when the fan is spinning and when the fan isn't spinning i have no S0 S3 and S5

threads.title: macbook air no power <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: Are you getting CPU Vcore? If yes then check all resistors in series with the data lines from SPI ROM. But really this could be anything at this point....

threads.title: macbook air no power <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
I'm getting CPU VCORE
This is a list with the rails that are 0V:
<SIGNAL>PP15V_TBT</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>PPHV_S0SW_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT</SIGNAL> 0.6V insted of 0.75V
data line from SPI ROM are ok
This time the machine has a full fan spin but no dong when I turn it on

threads.title: macbook air no power <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
PP0V6 is at 0.6V......seems fine with me. The rest is of course not of any interest for now.
Also in your post from 4 days ago it was doing on/off and now you have a stable CPU Vcore?

threads.title: macbook air no power <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: That's the problem. Last time I heard a few times a dong and then on off thing but i did reflow a few chips and now is stable but no sound when I power on and the cpu is stable

threads.title: macbook air no power <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: You reflowed some chips.....explain.

threads.title: macbook air no power <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
This is the second bord with the same problem I found <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> at pin 8 bad trace the pin 8 was burned. replaced the <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> and the same thing i have a fan spin but no dong no imagine nothing.
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> are 15V instead of 18.5V

threads.title: macbook air no power <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 8.6V
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS</SIGNAL> 8.6v

<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL</SIGNAL> 15.04 V

<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.42 v

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4_TBTAPWR</SIGNAL> 3.33v
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_S3</SIGNAL> 1.78v

Am I missing something?
what should I test next?

threads.title: macbook air no power <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: Not missing anything. There is corrosion under a chip somewhere. What chips were reflowed?

threads.title: macbook air no power <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: <CHIP>U3210</CHIP> had a pin that was looking strange. I did reflow and then i replace it and <TRANSISTOR>Q1840</TRANSISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q1842</TRANSISTOR>. I checked under microscope both board like 100 time and if I saw something strange i replace it and the same issue...it powers on i have green light the fan is spinning but no dong when is booting

threads.title: macbook air no power <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: if all the rails are present and I can't find any corrosion the fan is spining but i don't hear a don where do i have to look next?

threads.title: macbook air no power <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: I have no idea sorry. Again there could be corrosion under the SMC, CPU, memory no way to tell. Some boards just are not going to be fixed, especially not "over the internet".
